DOC.brief_title: Exercise Improve Sympathetic Modulation Chronic Heart Failure Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Retrospective study . Patients recruit database Rehabilitation Unit Cardiovascular Rehabilitation Exercise Physiology Heart Institute ( InCor ) . The aim study assess effect exercise train sympathetic modulation arterial baroreflex control patient chronic heart failure . The investigator study twenty-six chronic heart failure outpatient , age 30 70 year , functional class II III New York Heart Association , leave ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) ≤40 % peak oxygen uptake ( VO2 ) ≤20 . The exclusion criterion recent myocardial infarction unstable angina ( < 3 month ) , heart failure duration ( < 3 month ) , permanent pacemaker dependence , atrial fibrillation , skeletal muscle abnormality ( e.g. , arthritis ) participation regular exercise program . They assign 2 group : Untrained ( n=13 ) train ( n=13 ) .
